item.title: Henri Bergius
item.description:
Henri Bergius

Hacker and an occasional adventurer. Author of Create.js and NoFlo. Decoupling software, one piece at a time.

item.title: The museum filled with poisonous spiders that just won't die
item.description:
The museum filled with poisonous spiders that just won't die

It is close to midnight as I enter the Finnish Museum of Natural History in Helsinki by a back door. I am on the hunt for a deadly spider. As is fitting for a national institution, the museum boasts a significant collection of botanical, zoological, geological and palaeontological specimens from all around the world.

item.title: ​Inside a Billionaire's New Interstellar Mission
item.description:
​Inside a Billionaire's New Interstellar Mission

Yuri Milner is spending $100 million on a probe that could travel to Alpha Centauri within a generation-and he's recruited Mark Zuckerberg and Stephen Hawking to help. In an interview with ​ The Atlantic, Milner makes his case for star travel.

item.title: NASA Really Is Trying to Grow Potatoes on Mars
item.description:
NASA Really Is Trying to Grow Potatoes on Mars

As humans prepare to blast off to Mars, there is still the question of what they'll eat once they colonize the red planet. Scientists who have traveled here to the Peruvian desert say they have the answer. Potatoes.

item.title: The Internet of things you inherit or leave behind
item.description:
The Internet of things you inherit or leave behind

Between 2000 and 2010, Bryan and I lived a somewhat nomadic lifestyle. We moved more than fifteen times, including stays of varying lengths in three continents, six countries, three Canadian provinces, and four cities in the UK. After five wonderful years in Scotland, we've recently moved once again!

item.title: Russian photographer matches random people with social network photos
item.description:
Russian photographer matches random people with social network photos

For six weeks Yegor Tsvetkov, a young St. Petersburg photographer, has been snapping random people and then identifying them on Russia's biggest social network VKontakte with the help of the FindFace app (based on algorithms of self-learning neural networks).

item.title: In the Future, We Will Photograph Everything and Look at Nothing
item.description:
In the Future, We Will Photograph Everything and Look at Nothing

"Today everything exists to end in a photograph," Susan Sontag wrote in her seminal 1977 book "On Photography." This was something I thought about when I recently read that Google was making its one-hundred-and-forty-nine-dollar photo-editing suite, the Google Nik Collection, free.

item.title: Facebook's new Messenger bots are the slowest way to use the internet
item.description:
Facebook's new Messenger bots are the slowest way to use the internet

Today, Facebook announced a bold new bot initiative that lives inside its Messenger application: artificial intelligence-powered personalities at our beck and call for shopping, checking the weather, getting news updates, and more. There's just one problem: the bots are slow... painfully slow.

item.title: OpenPGP Best Practices
item.description:
OpenPGP Best Practices

We have gathered here a lot of information about configuring GnuPG. There are detailed explanations for each configuration suggestion. Many of these changes require you to make changes to the GnuPG configuration file on your machine located at ~/.gnupg/gpg.conf. For your convenience, all the suggested changes to the gpg.conf file are gathered in one place near the bottom of this page.

item.title: Uncovering the Luna Colony, a Lost Remnant of Spanish Florida
item.description:
Uncovering the Luna Colony, a Lost Remnant of Spanish Florida

One Friday last October, Tom Garner was driving through a residential neighborhood of wide lawns and old-growth oaks in Pensacola, Florida, on his way to lunch. Cutting through the cozy quarter, which is adjacent to his own, allowed Garner to avoid an eternally long traffic light across a major highway, and to keep an eye out for freshly turned soil.
